message_1: A student solved a recurrence relation to be T(n) = 2T(n-1) + 1, where T(1) = 1. What is T(5)?
message_2:
To find T(5), we will use the given recurrence relation and the base case T(1) = 1:

T(5) = 2T(4) + 1
T(4) = 2T(3) + 1
T(3) = 2T(2) + 1
T(2) = 2T(1) + 1

Now we can substitute the base case T(1) = 1:

T(2) = 2(1) + 1 = 3
T(3) = 2(3) + 1 = 7
T(4) = 2(7) + 1 = 15
T(5) = 2(15) + 1 = 31

So, T(5) = 31.
